SEARCH
Module group.ims
Package group.ims.Controllers

Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
group.ims.Controllers.ModifyProductController
public class ModifyProductController extends Object
This class controls what occurs within the "Modify Product" pane of the GUI.

  • Constructor Details

    • ModifyProductController

      public ModifyProductController()

  • Method Details

    • switch_BackToMain

      protected void switch_BackToMain() throws IOException
      This function is called to change the scene of the JavaFX application to the scene corresponding with the Main form. This function is used if a product is successfully added to the products list or if the user clicks the "Cancel" button in the "Modify Product" pane.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • searchParts

      public void searchParts()
      This function determines if the user input matches an existing part ID or part name. The user input can match portions of an existing part name; however, if the user inputs an integer to search by part ID, the provided input must match exactly an existing part ID. This function is used in the search bar above the top tableview in the "Modify Product" pane.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the first function called when the "Modify Product" pane is loaded, which initializes the top and bottom tableviews within the pane.

    • saveProduct

      public void saveProduct() throws IOException
      This function updates and saves information input into the various textfields within the "Modify Product" form for an already existing product. Errors associated with (1) strings being used as input where integers/doubles are expected, (2) ensuring that the "min" value is less than the "max" value, and (3) ensuring that the "inv" value is between the "min" and "max" values are all appropriately handled in this function.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • addAssociatedPart

      public void addAssociatedPart()
      This function takes a selected part within the top tableview of the "Modify Product" pane and copies the selected part into the bottom tableview of the "Modify Product" pane. Using this function temporarily (until the "Save" button his clicked) adds information within the product's associatedParts list. The top tableview displays a list of all parts, whereas the bottom tableview displays the product's associatedParts.

    • removeAssocPart

      public void removeAssocPart()
      This function is called to remove a part included in the bottom tableview of the "Modify Product" pane (i.e., remove a selected part from a product's list of associatedParts). This function is called when the user clicks the "Remove Associated Part" button in the "Modify Product" pane, assuming a part in the bottom tableview is already selected. The function handles the error where a part is not selected within the bottom tableview prior to the "Remove Associated Part" button being clicked.
